author: Snail
title: My worst Creator-Experience
review:
I got this model secondhand – usually, getting a creator set for a attractive price is like "what could ever go wrong?" ... well, if it is this set, it can, it's the first one of the creator series that is a real disappointment to me.

Building is easy, but is not very creator-like with rather basic bricks forming something beautiful by building it from bottom to top, instead it's quite modular, with technic parts connecting the modules.
The final model of the drone does not look like it's finished at all. The rear feels like something was forgotten, it even has a clip to attach things, but no idea what that could/should be. The propellers are actually "above" the protection frames, as they are too big to be fitted inside. The landing gear is instable and collapses under pressure. And the Windscreen looks like borrowed from City or some other theme, too specialised for Creator.
And then there are the second and third models (a "plane" and some rocket-chair-thing?), that are just plain laughable, not even close to the mediocre-at-best main model.

There are some usable parts in this, like 8 white quarter arches and the orange curved slopes. Also, some technic-parts like pneumatic connectors mis-used in this to attach the arches.

Playability ... i don't expect much there from Creator, but looking at this i'd want to move those propeller units to simulate steering ... nope, they are fixed in position. What's left is opening the wind screen, and "moving" the camera. A Minifig!? Nah, who needs that in such a feature-rich and well looking set?

I sincerely hope this is an exception in the usually great creator line or just slipped in from another line as it did not fit anywhere (it's neither coastguard nor police ...). If this is the direction creator is going, i'd stop buying anything that has only a scent of that spirit living in this set.

author: HuskyDynamics
title: 31071 Drone Explorer
review: The Drone Explorer is a fairly nice Creator set.  It has some shortcomings, including that it has some pretty bad rebuilds (no offense to LEGO), but that can be accepted due to the fact that it is just a humble $9.99 set.  There is not much to say about it, but the main build looks pretty fantastic alone.  It can fit a minifig (although the "Drone" portion of the name becomes void if you do so).  My only other note about this set is that if you buy two of them, you can build a not-so-terrible mini model of a S.H.I.E.L.D. Helicarrier.  It kinda works if you know what you are doing.

author: Puidwen
title: Not a fan.
review: I only built the drone mode, but i have to admit i'm not a fan.  While the set does have a nice selection of parts, i'm not too fond of the build.  for one thing it's a tad silly looking.  visually i feel like the rotor protectors should have gone around the rotors and not beneath them.  (you have to push them on the pegs just right by the way or they tend to fall off)  I feel that lego could easily have both the rotors and tail tilt which would have tremendously improve the set.  I do like the visual effect of the running lights.  And the cockpit does hold a minifig.  It's a pretty generous cockpit, it almost closed even with the minifig holding a peg launcher.

author: Beniaminek
title: Best from the cheapest
review: I still don't believe that this set cost so little. A lot of parts, three different models can be built. Great design of the flying vehicle and a place for a mini figure. Adaptive landing legs. A spacious and glazed interior that is easy to get into. Great fun building such a cheap set, which in addition is very large in the final version. A great set.
